trigger: Attenuation of <extra_id_0> gamma interferon <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced tyrosine phosphorylation in mononuclear phagocytes infected with Leishmania donovani : selective inhibition of signaling through Janus kinases and Stat1 .

The induction of gene transcription in response to <extra_id_0> gamma interferon <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is impaired in mononuclear phagocytes infected with Leishmania donovani , and the mechanisms involved are not fully understood .

The changes in gene expression brought about by <extra_id_0> gamma interferon <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are thought to involve transient increases in the activities of cellular protein tyrosine kinases , including the Janus kinases <extra_id_0> Jak1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Jak2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , leading to tyrosine phosphorylation of the transcription factor Stat1 .

To investigate the mechanisms accounting for the impaired responses to <extra_id_0> gamma interferon <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a model system for examining overall changes in protein tyrosine phosphorylation , activation of <extra_id_0> Jak1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Jak2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and phosphorylation of Stat1 was developed in phorbol 12-myristate 13-acetate-differentiated U-937 cells .

Analysis of whole-cell lysates by antiphosphotyrosine immunoblotting showed that incubation with <extra_id_0> gamma interferon <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> brought about specific increases in phosphotyrosine labeling of several proteins .

Increased labeling of these proteins occurred to similar extents in control cells and in cells that had been infected with L . donovani for 16 h . <extra_id_0> Jak1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> Jak2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and Stat1 were immunoprecipitated from control and interferon - treated cells , and tyrosine phosphorylation of these proteins , detected by antiphosphotyrosine immunoblotting was used to measured their activation .

Tyrosine phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> Jak1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> Jak2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and Stat1 increased markedly , in a dose - dependent manner , in U-937 cells incubated with <extra_id_0> gamma interferon <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

In contrast , in cells infected with L . donovani , tyrosine phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> Jak1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> Jak2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and Stat1 was markedly impaired .

This effect was dependent upon the duration of exposure to L . donovani and was maximal and complete at 16 h . Results similar to those observed with U-937 cells were also obtained with human peripheral blood monocytes .

These findings indicate that infection of human mononuclear phagocytes with L . donovani leads to impaired <extra_id_0> gamma interferon <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated tyrosine phosphorylation and selective effects on the Jak-Stat1 pathway .
Unresponsiveness to <extra_id_0> gamma interferon <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> for activation of this pathway may explain impaired transcriptional responses in leishmania-infected cells .
